Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: R. Tedesco "NU WAVE LOVER"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Target during the black friday sale. I was quite impressed being that I was coming off a typical point and shoot camera from Nikon. Coming from where I stand Ineed a camera that takes better still photos. im tired of the blurry shots I was getting from my old camera. It is true if you are taking pictures of something moving it will come out blurry...but there is a sports mode that takes clear shots of moving objects. Most camera's need alittle play time to get used to and reading the directions is helpful but straight out of the box this thing is self explainatory. I will give it 4 stars for the price I paid 99.99 and the fact that its a step up from my old and the zoom is unbelievable. And less the 5th star because the blurry thing. I'll have to remember to put it in that mode if the person or thing im shooting is moving. I did not want to spend 200 or more on a camera to get good shots for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Hold on before you return it. . . .
Reviews.Author: David K. Miller
Reviews.Content: I picked this up at Target on 12/24/11 ($99).  I'm still shopping for a better (and more expensive) camera, but the 15X zoom on this caught my attention.  I figured if the negative reviews were true I could still use it as a birding camera and just keep it in the car.I took about 100 shots last night in and outdoors, and another 100 today (in and out, sunny).  I'll admit I was ready to take it back after the first 50 because the auto settings produced too much blur.  Then I read the ENTIRE manual and tried some settings other than the defaults.  Based on my limited tests, here are some adjustments that will make you feel much better about the camera:*ISO is manually adjustable all the way up to 6400.  I'm getting decent low-light indoor shots at 800 without excessive noise.*Use the "slow sync" flash mode.  It illuminates with less glare in some situations but still provides enough light to freeze the action.*There are TWO types of Vibration Reduction (VR).  The normal mode works very well with the zoom at full extension and is the VR that's automatically set for most of the shooting modes.  But there is a 'hybrid' VR setting that snaps the shutter twice (at ISOs of 200 and below) and compares the images.  Processing time and saving is a bit longer but I was able to take indoor pictures (without flash) of my dogs moving around and get clear images.*The "exposure compensation" control appears to adjust the shutter speed within a limited range depending on the initial shooting mode that's selected.  If the flash is washing out your shots this control can damp that down some.*Try to pre-focus on 'sports' shots by holding the shutter halfway down on the spot where you anticipate capturing the movement. Finish the shot when the subject is in the center of the frame.  It's tricky but can yield some surprisingly good results.Notes: The f/stop setting is controlled by the level of zoom magnification.  (I haven't found a way to override that setting.)  All of the settings are displayed on the LCD when you push the shutter button halfway down so it's pretty easy to keep track of what works best - I'm generally setting the ISO higher and exposure compensation lower than the defaults suggest.  And, the performance of the zoom at full magnification with VR is really quite impressive.Bottom line:  This is a pretty decent camera and IMHO worth the price, if not more, for the Nikkor lens alone.  You do need to spend a little time getting acquainted but the results are worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: Spoiled Much?
Reviews.Author: iBelieb!
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at some of the reviews on here regarding the Nikon L105/110.  Reminder: This is an entry level, point and shoot digital camera boasting 12.1 MP.  Based on the quality of the pictures, the feel of the camera in your hands, and the general ease of use in capturing quality photos, it's a solid entry level option.  A legitimate 12.1 MP digital camera with a price tag of about $150, I think a 4/5 rating is fair.  Maybe some of you thought you were purchasing a Nikon SLR?

Reviews.Title: Great deal!
Reviews.Author: IristheViris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on black friday and I started getting sad after reading all of the reviews.  But after playing around with it, this camera is awesome!  I do admit that I wouldn't have bought it for $199, but it was on sale for $99.  At first I was having a little trouble with the focus, but after skimming through the CD owner's manual, this camera works perfect.  The zoom is fantastic and the pictures come out so clear, I love how light it is, and I just love how the pics come out!  The ONLY thing I don't like is the 3" LCD screen.  It's great and all, but with pics of people from far away (with scenery in the back), the people's faces look blurry, but when I zoom in to the pic, it's actually fine.  And when I download it on the computer, it looks great so it's just the preview pic on the camera.  That's it!  An awesome camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: What a Great Camera!  Incredible Zoom .... Incredible value!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Ok... we read all the reviews on this site and at Target regarding this nice camera...and  wanted to comment.  We love it!  Right out of the box it worked like a charm!  It has clear bright pictures, great flash, easy to use, professional looking and an incredible zoom!  For what...99.00... oh yeah!  We are not camera pros..so we do not have the experience comparing this product other high tech or expensive camera products. But, for what we will be using it for... family outings, facebook, etc. it is perfect!  Plus, the blurriness on occasion with action pics is alleviated with the sports mode, so these pics came out great too.  What is not to like.. for 99.00...wish I would have bought 2!

Reviews.Title: For the price?  Can't beat it.
Reviews.Author: Minxie
Reviews.Content: You can still buy this at Target for $99 by the way.  The only problem with the camera are the default settings. If you are using the wrong settings, you will get blurry pictures.  Any bad reviews for this camera are from people who do not know the proper techniques or are expecting too much from a point-and-shoot.  This camera, in my opinion, is a hybrid camera since it has a good lens.  Nikon is a respected brand.  The 4 AA batteries it takes are kind of a bummer but hey just get rechargables, whats the difference? The box comes with strap and lens cover.  The flash is very bright.  The interface is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price-quality
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "Le Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great for just 100. It takes better pictures than normal digital cameras. Sometimes the photos look blurry but just on the screen. On the computer most of them look beautiful. You need to learn how to set the camera for better pictures. It`s like the expensive one that take good pictures automatically. Please don`t compare this camera to 400 and above cameras. Some people just don`t get that the difference is not only the price but a set of qualities. This camera provide photos quality of a 250 camera.Who am I? Assistant to photographer with some years of experience.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera and great price
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: This camera ROCKS. Just got it on Black friday and once I figured out how to use the different settings it works perfect.I was a little concern when I first got it because the pics were blurring than I figured out that I had to raise the flash and know its great. I also took pics of the family playing frisbee and wow I got some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Great value, great camera
Reviews.Author: CameraPro
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera with wide zoom lens. Great photos and great value for the price.I love this camera much more than my current Sony.For the camera, always pick Canon or Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Cajun723
Reviews.Content: I picked this up from Target during the Black Friday sale. I wasn't really impressed with it at first, had some initial grainy pictures and thought about taking it back until I had an "aha" moment and decided to actually read through the manual. The settings on it are really cool and for the price you get a lot of bang for your buck. Granted it's not a Canon Rebel or anything like that but the pictures I took came out clear and the colors were great. My only real complaint is that it doesn't take great motion pictures so for that I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Tulshi
Reviews.Content: Just bought this camera and the pictures are great. Just what you would expect from a Nikon. It has all of the features that my sony cybershot has but more Megapixels. Took some Post Thanksgiving Day shots and they looked great when I printed them out on a small photo printer.

Reviews.Title: Worth $100
Reviews.Author: J. Sutton
Reviews.Content: I too bought this camera on Black Friday at Target for $100. At first I didn't think it worked very well and these reviews made me very nervous. After playing around with it for about a week and bringing it to my cousins wedding I am in love. This camera is great and maybe 5 out of the 80 pictures I took came out blurry. The key is to put it on an auto mode and it chooses which mode is best. I took many picture of the bride, groom, and guests dancing and they all came out completely clear. I have a sony camera that cost me $300 and I can ONLY take pictures where people are moving in a sports mode and the pictures were always too dark. This Nikon is amazing for $100 and I don't understand what these other people were expecting when they bought it...after all it's NOT a DSLR.  I must warn you that on the screen the picture LOOKS blurry, but when you zoom into it or put it on your computer the pictures are totally clear, so don't worry about that. Definitely worth it just take the time to play around with is and use the manual CD they give you it has a lot of good advice. Enjoy! [Also I'm still on the same batteries that came with the camera, even after a 5 hour wedding...so the battery isn't an issue, although I'd much rather find rechargeable ones so I don't have to keep spending money on batteries]

Reviews.Title: Settings to use
Reviews.Author: Jaimin Patel "Doc 4 Child"
Reviews.Content: Put it in the Auto mode by clicking the scene button (last option - not Easy Auto mode which is default first option) and use the built in flash- the images are best in this settings. Hope this will helps to some people.

Reviews.Title: Beyond Expectation
Reviews.Author: BobZ
Reviews.Content: Bought this one from Target.com for $100 the day before Black Friday (so did not spend a minute in store).  Did spent some time reading the manual (from included CD).  Once learned how to operate, this camera works surprisingly well.  Nothing fancy, but for the price paid, the camera exceeds my expectation.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine.
Reviews.Author: mommyofchristopher "mommyofchristopher"
Reviews.Content: The reviews here scared me because I was going to give this as a gift, and did not want to give a piece of junk.  So, I opened it up.  Initially, it did take crappy pictures, but then, once you select "auto" mode, the pictures turned out great.  Therefore, in order to get great pics, you need to change it from the initial factory setting which was semi auto mode to full auto mode.  Taking away one star for the noise it makes when it is focusing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera !
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Target's black friday sale and I've been taking photos with it all day inside and outside just to see how they would come out. Most of the pictures came out extremely clear and bright. The only downfall i would say it has is if there is a lot of moving the picture will come out with a big blur on it, so it is hard to take a picture of my dog playing outside because it just comes out a blur, but it's great if you like to take a lot a still shots. I have a Panasonic Lumix that cost me $250 and this camera takes way better pictures in low light than that camera! I was even taking pictures outside at night and they came out so clear and bright! Normally with my other camera when i take a picture inside the house it will look dark but this camera makes the pictures look so bright and clear no matter the lighting. I give it 4 stars because of the movement issue it has other than that it is a great camera for the price i got it for!

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for very little money.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Cunningham
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for its large lens and 15X optical zoom. I was pleasantly surprised with how well the menu's work. Rather than a dial on top of the camera to select shooting modes, it has a button on the back. You don't have to take your eyes off the view finder to change modes. Another great feature is the button that lets you start shooting video without taking your eyes off the back of the camera, again a seamless transition from video to still shots. The image stabilization works great, I can hand hold a 15X zoom pictures and get good results 3 out of 4 times. With a monopod or tripod it would be great. It seems to give good results in low light conditions. I have a lot of digital cameras. This is my new favorite. You need to take the time to learn how to use it. It has a lot of capabilities. If you do your part this camera will do it's part. It is most probably a much better camera than the average user is a photographer. Push down the button and let it focus. I love it. I can't imagine how much I will like it after I read the owner's manual. So far I am just poking around; it is very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Stripped down L110 model, ok for kids, plenty of better options
Reviews.Author: Blade "Blade"
Reviews.Content: I grabbed one of these at a black friday sale.  It was strange that they had so many with it being so late in the day.I turns out this is the same as the L110 minus the HDMI port.  You can google the pro reviews for the L110, they aren't good.  Pictures are soft and the stabilization is poor at best.  Even in bright light the images came out very soft and blurry looking.  I read some reviews before I grabbed one thinking that people were just bad at taking pictures, but it indeed is true, this camera just stinks.Stay away, there are much better choices even in this same price range.  Unless you really need 15x zoom and only have $100, find something else.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Billy
Reviews.Content: I had an older, middle of the road Olympus before buying this...it was clunky, rattled a bit from day one, and not so easy to use but it took good pictures for how old it was.  Battery life was also good.I've only had this Nikon for 1 day but am very happy with it.  It's great for the price.  Easy set up and easy to use.  Pictures taken so far have come out good to great.  Only a couple of blurry ones but I think that's operator error.  Perfect for what I need it for.

Reviews.Title: take out of easy auto mode
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: Was having the same problems as other reviewers with blurry poorly lit pictures. I followed the advice of another reviewer and changed the scene setting off of easy auto to just auto. Now the camera takes excellent crisp photos.

Reviews.Title: Great deal, on black friday!!!
Reviews.Author: Surekha
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on black friday from Target, just for 99 $. When I read review, i felt little bit sad, reading not good. When I started using this camera, faced some problem because of some settings problem, the pictures i took was blurred. But once setting was done, it works well. Took very nice and good quality pictures.  The price is less because it operates on alkaline batteries. Its really great deal for just 99 $, one cant get 12.1 MP and 15 X zoom with 3 LCD for just 99 $.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for less than you would pay for standard point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Datjushappend
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife @ target as a Christmas present. She opened the camera and was upset because she thought I had spent a lot of money on the camera. After she started to take some pictures of our dog in our house and we noticed that the pictures were blurry. We read the quick start guide and realized we had to raise the flash manually. After we raised the flash, the pictures were no longer blurry. I have to admit the quality of the LCD screen is not great and shows the photos as being kind of grainy however, when we loaded the pictures on to the computer the shots she took were amazing. The sports mode is fantastic for getting shots of our dog running. If you think you are getting a DSLR then you will be dissapointed but if you want a good hybrid camera that has excellent zoom, then it is tough to beat the quality and price of this camera. On a side not: After a couple of days I told my wife that the camera was only $99.00 she could not belive it. If your local target does not have this camera then pick one up her because this camera is well worth the $150.

Reviews.Title: battery hog!
Reviews.Author: KenC
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera except it eats batteries!My granddaughter loves it.A good buy for anyone who wants a startup camera.

Reviews.Title: Good value, great zoom camera
Reviews.Author: Winston
Reviews.Content: This a great camera for 99 bucks. 12 Megapixels and 15x zoom! You need steady hands or a tripod when using the long end of the zoom. If not, you'll get blurry pictures.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: jana
Reviews.Content: I am very happy. The magnificent chamber. Smartly takes a photo and video. You need to adjust only a mode what to you it is necessary and to enjoy filming. Fine acquisition for such not a big price.

Reviews.Title: not good for pictures of kids
Reviews.Author: mommarn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on black friday randomly thinking it would be good to take of my kids, all pictures are blurry without the flash on I have tried everysetting. I would not reccomend this camera to anyone specially with kids. My $50 dollar camera took way better pictures

Reviews.Title: definitely
Reviews.Author: shopper
Reviews.Content: Ok first off I am no pro, but being the son of an artist ive had my share of time with cameras. For $140 this is an amazing deal! Ive only had the camera for a few days now but ive made a few videos and took a lot of pictures. Now if your expecting a slr then go elsewhere this isnt the place for you. But if you want a really nice camera with amazing zoom and 720p hd video, plus some nice features. With out the huge price tag.. I would highly recommend this! Never the less it looks great, has that professional feel to it.

Reviews.Title: amateur photo review L105
Reviews.Author: markb
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures for over 30 years and have 4 film slr cameras and lenses. I have two older Digital point and shoots and wanted a camera with more reach and modern megapixel count. The Nikon L105 is a great camera for the money, but you need to read the directions. It has great menu options and it is true you need to go to Sport action to take pictures of a moving subject and end up with crisp pictures. I work at Target and have heard two people complain about the blury pictures. In talking with them, it is obvious they never read the manual and don't understand how to use the camera. Just read the book and enjoy the camera. It is not a D90 DSLR but it is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With Results
Reviews.Author: C. Dallas
Reviews.Content: We have been using various point and shoot cameras.  We photograph everything for our grandchildren and children. We have had little success in having good photos inside building such as Churches and sports areanas.  This new camera was purchased just prior to Christmas.  It provides excess zoom qualities inside.  Instead of walking up front I can make the camera take the journey. It was easy to learn how to operate too.  I love the camera. If you are considering, purchase it and give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Not a run of the mill Point and Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Schunkey
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera because I want to get into SLR's eventually but am not quite familiar with camera modes yet. I bought this after reading that it is a good entry-level "bridge" camera for inbetweeners - and I was not steered wrong! This camera has excellent picture quality and a variety of great options, I absolutely love playing with it.This is not a simple point and shoot camera, it is definitely a bridge, and can take some getting used to. If your pictures are "noisy" (i.e. grainy) reduce the ISO by simply going to the Menu and selecting an ISO sensitivity. If the shutter speed is too slow, stop taking pictures in darker settings. If the flash is washing everything out, turn it off, or play around with the different scenes, and if you want motion pictures, utilize the sports mode that will give you non blurry shots. Since I've had it, I've had one blurry shot because I made it that way.As for the battery operation, I prefer it (although I might be the only 24 year old that does), but instead of forgetting a battery charger on vacation and being SOL, I can just run to the nearest store and pick up a four pack of AA's - it's not like it takes a specialty 50$ battery or something.Overall, if you take the time to get to know the camera it is absolutely, positively worth every penny. Be sure to check out a local target and ask if they have the L105 in stock, my Target did not have it out on display, it was tucked under the display case. If you are looking for a decent beginner bridge camera, and have the patience to learn different shots, I absolutely recommend this camera. I cannot get over the fantastic picture quality and for $99.00 you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Alexis Carrington "SEXCi LEXi"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on Black Friday from Target and i absolutely love it ! The picture quality is amazing and it's super easy to use. I don't understand the negative reviews -- GREAT BUY !

Reviews.Title: Great value in a small package
Reviews.Author: Raihan Hannan
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting to buy a new digital camera for some time. This camera is very compact in size for a coolpix. Love the quality of the photos and video and very easy to use. The camera has a good optical zoom, but the only I had is the zooming was a bit on the slower side.Bottom line is, i love this camera for the compact size, photo & video quality and price.

Reviews.Title: disapointment
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much when I ordered this camera, and was quite surprised with the quality of images.  Sure its not great in low light, but switch from easy auto mode to auto mode and it takes very good pictures in decent lighting.  About a week after purchasing the LCD monitor developed inverted colors making it impossible to compose a photo.  At the same time the camera began to freeze randomly after shots.  I was disappointed since I had traveled across the country and was looking foreword to getting some landscapes in the big lenses but I didn't let it get me down because I knew Nikon would take care of it..  wrong.  The warranty on this brand new camera was voided by the fact that I didn't get it from one of Nikon's approved dealers.  So I'm out $130 and I have a nice Nikon paper weight.  On the bright side I've learned that I should purchase a Canon next time.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Worth Buying
Reviews.Author: G. Jordan "Voracious Reader"
Reviews.Content: The camera is much smaller than it looks in the photos online, the menus are harder to access and figure out, and it does NOT come with ANY photo editing software! What does come on CD with it is a photo viewer, a panorama pic program and a user manual on disk only (quick start guide is very limited). The website for uploading Nikon images to does NOT have photo editing capabilities, I couldn't even find a place to add tags to images, though ratings and labels are easy to find. I'll stick with Flickr. My 1st test images lacked color, were either washed out of over-saturated yellow, many were fuzzy & low quality even with flash. I was using the "Easy Auto" default, but when I switched it to regular "Auto" mode, the colors were more realistic, there is a full menu there for white balance and other settings, though it is not at all intuitive in getting to those menus.The best things are that it is the easiest camera to use right out of the box, without reading the user manual. One just inserts 4 AA batteries, turns it on and waalaa. The zoom is extremely powerful & fast! It beats my pro DSLR camera in speed and telephoto capability. The built-in memory is perfect to start off with, but one will want a memory card for more capacity, though it took over 50 pics at 6 MP setting with no problem using camera memory without memory card installed. The flash is manual pull up, push down, and I don't see an easy way to access settings unless one chooses one of the program modes and edits through there, missing the shot if it's unexpected while figuring out and setting it up for the shot. The continuous shooting feature is incredible, I was able to make 3 GIFs of the resulting images immediately, didn't know what else to do with 40+ shots of my cat licking his lips. I wasn't aware it was shooting multiple images, I hit the shutter button accidentally and it was only in reviewing a later image that I found the 40+ images it shot silently from one button push! The quality was therefore extremely bad, since I had flash off and no tripod at the time. I look forward to experimenting with that feature while aware I'm doing so! However, the images of action come out clear, like stop-action photography. I'm not sure how one would do blurred water/moving images, as opposed to freeze frame, but being able to quickly capture an action image in excellent quality, sold.The video is very easy to use though there is no lighting settings as there are on digital camcorders (low light, daylight, bulb, etc) but there are scene modes that handle those situations, am just not sure the flash adjustments apply since one cannot use flash with video on the Nikon. I'll be testing the sound & low lighting tomorrow night filming a live band, and will update with the results then.One of my favorite aspects of this camera are the easily accessible features right on the rear navigation buttons--macro, self-timer, flash and EV adjustments, all one touch access without scrolling through menus to find. The Delete button, review button (for seeing images previously taken, then easily deleting while viewing, or protecting from deletion), menu and video buttons are all on the rear panel. The zoom is left/right slide on the top right of the camera. The battery compartment has space for one memory card.Least fave aspects: this camera requires the lens cap be off to access any menus or setup scenes in advance, as well as to review images to delete them. Since the camera will not take accessory lenses or filters (such as ones to protect the lens), this makes the lens easy to damage and smudge. In fact, when I tried a close up on my cat, his nose smudged the lens numerous times as well as condensation from his breathing on it (he explored it while I shot, I did not put it on his nose :) Lastly, the size of the camera is much much smaller than expected. The lens and LCD screens looked huge to me in all advertisements and the included product info, but in reality they are small, with little weight to the camera & a thinner plastic body than I am used to.All in all, I would recommend this camera to most budding photographers, a portable option when watching sports and action events, or for those like me, who have extensive DSLR cameras who need an inexpensive & quick option for video AND high quality photos when lugging all the other gear out isn't needed for the situation. My goal was to find good quality video and camera in one unit, and I have tried many products (mostly camcorders that promised great photos too & failed) & been disappointed, until now. If it can handle the loud bands I film, it might even become a favorite, but if not, I have a special camcorder that will.

Reviews.Title: OK for beginners, I was not impressed.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Kendall "Kendall Photography"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for a beginner, but no way compares to the Nikon Coolpix P520. Also a year after I bought it, it started doing something weird. THe flash makes a "popping" sound when it fires. Like an explosion. Nikon said they had never heard of such a thing.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of equipment for the price
Reviews.Author: Charlene A. Howell "AngelExpanding"
Reviews.Content: I've ALWAYS enjoyed taking pictures of scenery and didn't want to continue to clutter up my phone's storage space (especially after my old memory card got damaged & erased ALL of my pics). So, I asked for this camera as a graduation present and I'm glad that I did. I've been putting it to good use ever since. I'm strongly considering upgrading to a professional-grade camera in the future after hearing positive reviews about Nikon equipment.

Reviews.Title: My second review on this product
Reviews.Author: Casey Brown-Myers
Reviews.Content: I simply love this camera and after using this camera for several months, I love it even more. This camera is a steal at this price.

Reviews.Title: I bougth for a good price
Reviews.Author: Jesus Resendiz Rodriguez "CHUYTIME"
Reviews.Content: This camcorder is a great product for the price an I recomended to my daughter and my son an all my family

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Lily
Reviews.Content: I also bought this camera about a year ago at Target's Black Friday sale. For $100, this bridge camera is a great deal. While it does not take the best photos indoors, it can take some pretty quality photos outside.One thing I noticed--the zoom can create some DSLR-esque photos. Put it to good use. Stand farther away and use the zoom to blur the background--it may take a few tries, but the ultimate effect is much better.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L105 Consumer Review
Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: I received my Nikon Coolpix L105 a few years ago as a birthday gift. After having it for a while and being able to see all of its different capabilities, I can say it is a good camera overall. It has some great features including things such as a color LED screen, playback zoom, ability to change and display camera settings, tripod mount, digital as well as optical zoom, a macro mode, EXIF data recording, and black-and-white, sepia, and infrared modes. I would say that this particular camera is more in-between a standard point-and-shoot camera and a digital SLR. Although not having all the features of an SLR, I believe this camera and its newer models make for a great starter camera for someone who has a hobby in photography.

Reviews.Title: great camera!!
Reviews.Author: just started
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.I wanted to let everyone know you can use different lens with the camera if youpurchase the extender.I received my extender along with a super wide angel HD lens and a  super telephoto lens andI have just begun to play around with them.You can get a lot of camera for a little money!

Reviews.Title: My first refurb.
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought this refurbished for my accident prone sister, I could have got it brand new 10 bucks cheaper on black friday at target but I missed that.  It came in a white cardboard box  factory certified by Nikon with all included accessories and looked shiny and brand new. Minus the sticky screen protector that some people refuse to ever take off. It took very nice pictures even without the flash right out of the box. Good starter camera for someone trying to develop photography skills.

Reviews.Title: looks good but picture quality less than expected
Reviews.Author: Tina Ahlberg
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking camera but the picture quality on some of the settings like "easy auto mode" and "smart portrait" do not take the quality of pictures I expected. I guess for the price I shouldn't be too choosy but have to admit overall product disappointment. It was shipped to me quickly though.

Reviews.Title: Impressed especially for price
Reviews.Author: LouBomb89
Reviews.Content: I personally have a t3 Canon and my wife a d5100 nikon and while this is not a SLR camera it does it job pretty good. I payed 99 bucks for it, i was planning to give it to my nephew as a bday gift, and I kind of want it for myself. People here complain about grainy pictures and blurred images, im sorry but either you should not be handling this camera or go buy a polaroid. All my pics have came out quite well and with Adobe LightRoom i can perfect it. Great camera for daily use not an SLR so dont compare it to one.

Reviews.Title: It depends how you use it...
Reviews.Author: Joseph George
Reviews.Content: If you want to see how well this works and the quality of the pictures it takes look at my blog [...]

Reviews.Title: click
Reviews.Author: snapshot
Reviews.Content: This camera is soooo easy to use, I absolutely love it.  I'm taking pictures just because the camera is easy to use.  I would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry Level Camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: voidandshadow
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few months now and felt I've had enough time with it to offer an opinion.Let me start by clarifying some basic facts about this product:- It is not an SLR and should not be compared to one.- The L105 was made exclusively for Target by Nikon and that is why so little information can be found about it.  I've always had positive experiences with Target so I really don't have any issues with this.The Nikon L105 is great entry level super-zoom camera.  It offer more features and higher optical quality than most point and shoots without the large price tag typically fount on super-zoom cameras like the P500 (~ $300).  It takes phenomenal pictures outside and its "easy" mode will automatically pick whatever settings it thinks are right for the environment.  If you don't like it's choices its very easy to change.  I did find that pictures taken indoors tended to be less crisp than those taken outside and the camera has a tendency to really pick up the "yellow" given off by an entirely light-bulb lit room.  It does use 4 AA batteries, and initially this bummed me out a little, but I have yet to go through them; so it seems to have decent battery efficiency. I'd like to emphasize again that the L105 is intended as an entry level camera; if you are someone that's used to lugging around 10 lbs of SLR gear this camera is not for you and, frankly, it wasn't made to be.Bottom Line: Wonderful product for the price and a great camera for people who would like better pictures than what a point and shoot can offer without having to pay $400.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Tabata
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because for someone like me does not have any skill in photography this camera  is excellent choice. Also price was affordable.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I've just bought this camera on sale and I love it a lot. Great scene modes, very comfortable to hold, compact. I would buy it anyway, on a sale or not. I recommend you to buy a battery charger, because the batteries it comes with are not rechargeable and gets low easily. I am so happy to have it!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I love my camera! I got it the day they said I would get it...I would totally purchase something from them again :)

Reviews.Title: Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the money.  Delivery was prompt.  The only problem is that the hd 8g memory card does not allow me to download pictures from the camera to the pc unless I use the cord connection.  This is really not a complaint against the camera, but if you have an older pc, you may have this problem.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera from Target. Yes, you certainly need to change the mode in order to get a good image. I tried both easy auto mode and indoor/party mode for a indoor shoot. The easy auto model gives blurred image while the indoor mode provides sharp image.One con is that the image stabilization only works in camera mode and not in video mode. So you cannot zoom too much when recording a video.When comparing with L110, L105 misses the wind noise reduction in video mode. Refreshing a L110 firmware may work.

Reviews.Title: Poor camera, even at Black Friday prices
Reviews.Author: Paul Tiseo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at Target due to their Black Friday special on it (~$100). Took it home and proceeded to test the heck out of it. Took 125 pictures, indoor and outdoor, with many of the various presets and defaults changed for really investigating what this camera could do.End result: I almost immediately got back in my car, and returned the camera to Target.Out of all those pictures, only about maybe 10% were of borderline acceptable quality. Most were grainy, blurry or washed out/lacking in color. There was significant noise in ALL the images, such that even some untrained eyes I put on the images said the same thing. Many were over/underexposed, bleached by flash, or just bad. Also, I noted that even if I occasionally got the image in focus, the edges of the image were still blurry. Worse yet, the shutter was usually slow, meaning you'll never get good shots of kids or pets, or anything with any movement for that matter.Sometimes, it is acceptable if you can fiddle your way to a good image. This is after all a "bridge" camera between the just-aim-and-press crowd and the SLR crowd. However, even here we failed. This camera lacked good manual control. Sometimes, some control was granted in some of the preset modes, but all in all, it was just a bad user interface.Other minor nits: uses AA batteries, and you apparently should not use rechargeable per manual.Most telling is that a search for the L105 at Nikon USA's website returns nothing.I wanted a good camera with more zoom and better optics than the average diminutive point-and-shoot to take pictures of my daughters at events where 5x zoom isn't quite enough. I neither have time to fiddle with settings nor the grace of terrific lighting conditions to make this camera work.I do not recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: fraud
Reviews.Author: cdsd
Reviews.Content: Purchased it for a bday gift as a new camera imagine how embrassed I was when it was openedwith no manuel and someone elses photos on camera. I paid for a brand new camera and got a used one thats fraud. Never again will I buy from this seller He should be kicked off this site a real crook

Reviews.Title: Returned ..
Reviews.Author: Resident Skeptic
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this review before actually having purchased the camera, please read on. OTOH, you already have the camera and like it mucho, skip reading this review, you have made the perfect decision, enjoy it!Bought it on BF sale from Target for $99. A day later, having shot about 50 pictures, I decided to return it for the following reasons:1. Flash used indoors invariably over-exposed the subject, while the same shots came out much nicer without flash. The flash is not auto, I had to pop it open manually.2. Moving subject resulted in blurry picture - and I am talking about my kid on his bicycle, not a high-speed projectile!3. When the object is too close, the camera provides a "not in focus" warning, but the lens motor keeps trying to focus and you can hear it. Why does it simply not stop? Poor design choice!4. The zoom is not very well controlled, which I presume comes from having only a few 'stops' between the W and T extremes for the zoom.5. While the picture size is ~2.4 MB, the camera took a while in writing to a cheap Lexar card. It could simply be the card.6. I was unable to connect the camera with the provided cable to 2 different computers. In each case, the L105 monitor turned on, which should not have happened, if the connection procedure is documented correctly.7. I called Nikon USA for help with the connection problem, but could not sort it out and suggested that I go to Target as this camera was created for Target. Wow! That was an honest feedback! Therefore, I conclude, the 199 MSRP is a price at which the camera was never sold to one single buyer, it was meant to be a 99 dollars goody.In summary - this camera is marred by several shortcomings or flaws or design choices, which I find unacceptable at the price I paid. Target accepted the return without a question. Apparently lot of returns were made because of 4xAA batteries being used.

Reviews.Title: Just So-So
Reviews.Author: latreesh
Reviews.Content: I also purchased this camera as a Black Friday deal at Target and boy do I feel silly!  I normally do a lot of research prior to buying electronics, but it looked like a fantastic deal and I was caught up in the spirit of Black Friday! I suppose for the price, the camera takes okay pictures.  Suitable for one of my kids to have, but if you are looking to take high-quality, memorable shots of your family, events, etc- go ahead and spend a little more money on something else.  However, despite the poor-quality pics, my Nikon is now displaying "Lens Cap Error" every time I turn it on.  THAT is the nail in the coffin (so to speak) for my poor review of this camera because I can not take ANY photos and the manual has no "troubleshooting" section.  And on the Nikon website, I can find nothing in reference to this camera.  So, I would advise anyone looking to STEER CLEAR of this camera- you get what you pay for...  And amazingly, Nikon does not sell this model on their website- I wonder why...?

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: J. Gigowski "blest mama"
Reviews.Content: I was another who bought this during the Black Friday sale at Target. I have had nothing but misery with the thing! And of course the box was misplaced, so I wasn't able to return it. I'm out 100 bucks. If I could give it a negative numbered review, it would be -10 out of five.The only time it took decent pics was outside. Inside you MUST use the flash, and even when you do, the pics aren't great, especially the coloring of them.I tried to use the feature that lets you take photos in rapid succession (can't remember the term at the moment) and outside, with a slowly moving object or person, it worked fine. Inside, with a nearly still person (just trying to get the right smile) it was AWFUL. Horribly grainy, bad coloring, everything.I am so disappointed in this camera I can't even begin to explain. It also makes me not want to trust anyone's positive reviews again! I'm scared to buy a new camera now.

Reviews.Title: Nice, affordable camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela Saunders
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new camera for Christmas and had seen a family member using this camera at a wedding. I asked her what she thought of it, and she said she loved it. The price is very reasonable and the camera takes excellent photos. The only thing I need is a camera bag. I haven't had the camera more than a couple of weeks, so I haven't had a lot of time to play around with it. However, so far it has been very easy to use. I would recommend it to anyone who is just looking for a camera to take "everyday, amateur" photos. I like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Not good for the creative photographer
Reviews.Author: S. Zimmerman "Horn Blaster"
Reviews.Content: I will keep this nice and short. First, I will list the cons.Nikon didn't put a whole lot of effort into this one, if you ask me.-The noise factor is a big issue, even at ISO 80. (So not a good low-light camera; with or without flash.)-Picture quality is poor in terms of detail.-Bad contrast-Low color capabilities-SERIOUS Lack of manual settings. If you are a dedicated, creative photographer, you probably detest the use of Auto Mode. This camera is basically stuck on Auto Mode. You can't be creative with this one!-VERY SLOW... Example: Takes forever to take two shots. I'd say it shoots at 1/3.5 pictures per second. (A shot every three and a half seconds.)Overall, my bad portion of the review would stress, in a few words: This is a glorified cell phone camera and is overpriced.Pros:-Fairly good 720p HD with good, not great, audio. (Mono, not stereo. See here for a video I recorded with this camera: [...])-It has a pretty decent zoom and wide angle lens.-Compact and affordableMy Pros section would stress that this is a good camera if you aren't interested in pro photography. If you want to just capture the moment with the simplicity of a cell phone, this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: Crisp pictures!
Reviews.Author: Matt- online nook
Reviews.Content: Those one star reviews are complete lies, in fact I think if you were to get the nikon one this one takes as good pictures of the nikon one. Two things you shoud knoware: 1: this camera is small and light for vacations 2: this camera is a perfect camera for beginers or kids. Over all this is a realy good camera.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: UW MOM
Reviews.Content: I got this camera from my kids for christmas.  I was sooo excited.  As I had wanted a camera for some time.  They picked it up at Target during the sale, so they had not been able to get reviews in advance.WELL.  I took this on literally a once in a lifetime trip:  The Great Wall in BeijingI took it out of the box, got extra batteries, packed it and off I went-Carry on only.Got to Beijing, took a few pictures around town, feeling pretty comfortable in how to use it given I didn't want to mess up when I was at the Great Wall.No issues, although the initial batteries did not last more than 35 pictures, but alas, I had anticipated that and had more!(actually I did have some times where the camera was irratic and would and would not take pictures as it said the battery was low)  I put in new high use batteries.Finally the tour bus gets us to the "wall".  I get out all smiley and ready to walk the Great Wall.Got ONE picture.  I am not kidding.  ONE.  Even with the new batteries, it would turn on but have a blank screen-white and nothing else.  Took batteries out, put them in again just in case I messed up.  Nothing.  Had my husband try.  Had my 14 yr old son try.  NOTHING.I come home with ONE picture of the Great Wall on my camera, 5 on my husbands Iphone.DO NOT BUY.  HEARTACHE.  HORRIBLENot only did I not get Great Wall pictures, but my kids were sad that they had gotten me a bum camera when they were so excited to have gotten me one.  Too late to return of course, so I guess I have to add to the garbage sites and that does not make me happy either.

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: S. Ramsey
Reviews.Content: Returning the camera, it is not that great. Think of this phone as a stripped down version of his sister version. I read a lot of reviews that say you need to use focus, auto focus, I don't have the camera in my hand right now, but i tried that. I shouldn't have to be limited to useing a certain feature to get good pics. I have an old camera and it has a lot of pro features in it that i use and it takes great shots. I bought this for the zoom. I used this yesterday in low light and it seems i needed a tripod to get a clear shot. The colors were off and i know for a fact my old camera would take a better shot since it is awesome in low light. Seems you can not change the ISO in this camera either. At first I was like " it is $99", but now i am like i rather put the $99 into somethin better. I don't have a lot of light at my place, and my iphone took a better picture then this. The flash washed out everything. So the reviews who say you dont know how to use this camera, you shouldn't have to "use this camera in a special way". People that say it take great shots, take a bunch of them in low light, outside, inside. Not perfect. My old camera is a Canon Sd1000 by the way. $160 i think when i bought it 4 years ago.**UPDATE** I was reading a review on a memory card and it was noted that they user said his card was slow and the pictures were blurry. He bought a Class 10 card and the issue was resolved. I wonder if that is the issue here, most of us are using cheap old cards? I can tell you have a 8GB Class 4 that I was using. I wondering if the people shooting great pics are using something better. I just bought the WINTEC FileMate 16GB Professional Class 10 card. I will update my review and see if it is any better. I haven't returned the camera yet, but will see after this one.

Reviews.Title: Not a good purchase!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly L. Brashears
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera today from Target.  After reading the manual and reading reviews, I couldn't figure out how to get the pictures not to be blurry! I tried everything and I am truly exhausted!  This was one of my worst purchases!  I am taking this back today.  I would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazon camera purchase
Reviews.Author: Jane Peacock
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas present for my sister. She loved it when she saw it, but she has returned to her home 8 hours away and I don't know if she has tried it or not. I looked it over and it has all the features of the more expensive cameras, looks to be a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money!!
Reviews.Author: Christina T
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera seeing as it was a good price and Nikon's name was behind it, but was very disappointed. I took over 100 pictures and only a few turned out not blurry.  You would have to have little movement and great lighting conditions for this camera, honesty my Canon point and shoot camera is better.

Reviews.Title: Just so so camera. big flaws
Reviews.Author: Good
Reviews.Content: I also got the camera from target black friday sale. It is good looking and looks like professional when I open the box. When I took picture under the auto mode, it turns out to be fine, as clear as the pics I used my old Nikon. However, after I played around for about 5 minutes, it showed the battery is exhausted. what the heck, I used four brand new batteries, how come it can be exhausted in 5 mins. Also, I tried to use the close up mode to take some close pictures, the camera turned off automatically. Although it does have a good zooming, it operates quite slowly and has noise. I took it to the target to see if this is normal. Unfortunately they didn't know anything about this camera. I had to end up with returning it.Just a reminder: I bought it online and paid through Paypal. Target can't refund to my credit card. the only thing you can get is just a Target gift card.Don't expect too much for this camera. It is not a high-end or decent camera since the regular price is only 199.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: AmazonDana
Reviews.Content: I bought this at the Black Friday sale as well, and no matter what I do, I still get blurry images.  I am not a camera snob whatsoever, but find my small Kodak Easyshare is WAY better than this thing.  It was cheap though, but for the same $, I think I could have gotten a smaller camera that takes better pictures.  I tried to return this to Target within the 90 day expiration date on the receipt, but it was 2 days past the 45 day expiration on electronics (who knew?) so now I am stuck with this piece of junk.  I will never buy anything electronic from Target again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing!!!
Reviews.Author: Billa
Reviews.Content: I really did try to like this camera.I also got this for $99 at Target on black friday.I actually got 2 of them to give 1 as a gift.When I tried to take pictures, EVERYTHING was blurry.I tried to change scene settings and everything but nothing worked.I took picture of far away objects as well as close-up objects.Nothing helped it to focus.Maybe it is the Target version that has this problem.I am really disappointed...So much for waiting in line. UGH!Anyways, I am heading to Target to return this item.

Reviews.Title: Bad Experince
Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: I also purchased this cam on Black Friday from Target.The actual price of this cam was $199 but in Target it was $99, i was to happy after buying but when i opened and Test the Cam not to happy. Main issue is that if you take moving picture, picture quality is not too good and other thing is battery issue.So finally i am planing to replace and look for new one.

Reviews.Title: Horrible pictures!
Reviews.Author: kbrown
Reviews.Content: Just bought and then immediatly returned this camera to Target. I purchased it for 99.00 during their black friday sale. The first 50 pictures where blurry and grainy.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PAY MORE THAN $100 FOR THIS CAMERA. ANYONE SELLING IT FOR MORE THAN THAT IS, UP SELLING IT.
Reviews.Author: Josue M
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT THE CAMERA ON BLACK FRIDAY AT TARGET. THEIR WERE A LOT OF THESE CAMERAS IN STOCK EVEN AFTER THE RUSH. WHEN I SAY A LOT I MEAN ABOUT 50+ CAMERAS. IT WAS A NICE BUY, THE PICTURES DO COME OUT NICE AND CLEAR, ITS A BIT BULKY BUT THE WIFE FEELS LIKE ITS A PROFESSIONAL CAMERA LOL. I WOULD RECOMMEND DOING RESEARCH ON CAMERAS BEFORE JUST GOING OUT AND BUYING THEM LIKE I DID. IF I WOULD OF KNOWN IF THIS CAMERA WAS SO UN HEARD OF, I PROBABLY WOULD OF NEVER GOT IT. I WENT TO THE NIKON AND TARGET WEBSITE, AND COULD FIND NOTHING ABOUT THIS CAMERA...SO ITS LIKE AN UNKNOWN CAMERA AT THIS TIME. BUT IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A FANCY LOOKING DECENT CAMERA, PAY NO MORE THAN $100 LIKE I DID.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever.
Reviews.Author: suzy
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I ever wrote on Amazon. I had to make a comment because I was so dissatisfied with the nikon coolpix L105. I also purchased this camera at target. Every picture I took was blurry.  The light was also very poor and all my pictures were greatly discolored.  I never bought a camera before that I  struggled taking every picture.  The camera also had a flimsy battery cover.  I brought the camera back to target.  I bought a nikon coolpix p500 during the summer, which I returned.  The shutter broke while on vacation.I just purchased another sony.  I purchased a sony cybershot dsc-h70. Every picture taken with this camera is superb.  I have no blurry pictures thus far.  I  have always purchased sony cameras and will continue.  My next camera will be a sony nex 5n.  I will not experiment with another brand again.  Stick with a sony you cannot go wrong.

ProductInfo.Name: Nikon L105 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Zoom - Black
